intro: Thlaspi vulgatius, commonly known as the common cabbageworm plant, is a member of the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing, herbaceous plant that typically reaches a height of about 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features small, rounded leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of wax, giving them a slightly fuzzy appearance. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, round pods that contain several seeds. Thlaspi vulgatius is often found in disturbed soils and is commonly associated with agricultural areas.
